meanings.sent1: The king was discrowned by the rebels.
meanings.sent2: The queen was discrowned after the revolution.
meanings.sent3: The jester discrowned the king as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The storm discrowned the statue in the square.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick discrowned the volunteer on stage.

meanings.definition: Deprive (someone) of royal status or authority
meanings.sent1: The dictator discrowned the nobleman and banished him.
meanings.sent2: The revolution discrowned the tyrant and established a new government.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy discrowned the prince in the story.
meanings.sent4: The scandal discrowned the once-beloved celebrity.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal discrowned the loyal knight in the kingdom.
